Vikram - Vedha (2022)
    If you're looking for what just might be recognized as the very highly tense action thriller of the last few years, then, go no farther, you'll find it all here . . I guarantee it.  This action-packed high octane film, rocks!
And, if you don't agree to its hyper intensity, with special clashing twists and turns, you most certainly will upon the 'AlCOHOLIA' celebration!
  When going to see this film
be sure your mind is sharp and alert, for all the intracacies that you will be exposed to.
  The idea of 'Circles,' as presented in the movie 'Dark City,' (1998), will be further clarified in this action-packed thriller.  And, flavors of Ben Afflect's 'Accountant,' John Travota, and Nicolas Cage's, 'Face Off,' and, Russell Crow's 'L.A. Confidential,' will also be well noticed, where choices, punishment, corruption, and, just a simple one-on-one, and, varying phylosophies of rationalzation, motives and riddles, intervene.
  And, let me run this by you, and see if you might not agree, upon an old Japanese saying, 'Life is an Illusion.'
  This film is very well acted by all who participated in it.  I give it easily five stars.  My only pieve, was, it was awfully loud.  But, this may have been the fault of the projectionist.  I didn't want to miss the first part of this film, as I've complained up-front before about these things, so, I just jammed my ears with kleenex, in hopes that that, would curtail the concussive blows of the fuller force - if you know what I mean.  But, I must say it did enhance the special effects, when the base notes, and, emphasis, came into play.
  I plan to soon watch, and, willingly pay the extra ticket price to see this in IMAX.  Be prepared for a doozy of an all-out war between rivals who clearly believe their reasons should be validly pursued.

All style and hardly any substance make VIKRAM VEDHA a poor movie. The emphasis in the film was more on Hrithik's style, swagger, and his ability to be totally unfazed by any danger of any sort including death. Once again as is the norm in Hindi movies for the longest while, logic takes a complete back seat in this film. The gunmen are literally spraying him with bullets and not a single one touches him. Not much attention is paid to the story. Once again the songs were totally unnecessary. Everything about the film at best was average.
5/10

Brilliant script and screenplay. This is a very intriguing story that was well directed to make a highly engaging film. Hrithik Roshan is superb as the intelligent, ruthless and powerful Vedha.
He manages to deliver a hugely impactful performance in a controlled manner without any hamming at any point. Saif Ali Khan is effective as the Vikram who is the quieter character and who goes through a transformation.
Another thing I loved about the movie was the background score. It is really awesome, especially during action scenes and manages to give the movie an added dimension of fun/ gangsta vibe. 

Overall I loved the movie and would recommend it as a definite theater watch.
